heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: Today experienced the closest lightning strike on record since monitoring began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 13 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.8°C) and outside temperature (down 5.3°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.9 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1050 m), feels like temperature (up 9.9°C), outside temperature (up 8.3°C), and dew point temperature (up 5.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 445.7m lower than yesterday, 696.4m lower than the past week, 1050.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 845m and a high of 3460m, averaging 1141.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, occasional overcast conditions, and the light is absent. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
